programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers search for hiking and camping gear, and Dave Hester reveals the secrets of auction success.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen drags Ton to a weekend auction, where newbie buyers cause problems and a rickshaw, a wrecking ball and blast detonators feature.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A tough group of bidders decide to take on Allen and Ton at auction, where the guys try to sell an arsenal used by Native Americans.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Tensions mount when a man loses his temper over a mix-up with his gold chain. Meanwhile, an allegedly cursed relic scares Ashley.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee shocks the family by turning violent, and Ashley loses her temper when someone tries to steal her underwear.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank explore a crumbling building full of salvaged gems, but have a hard time getting the valuables out safely before the roof caves in.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A family of hunters feels the pressure, and starts taking big risks in the pursuit of alligators.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The work of a rescue team on Canada's Cascade Mountains. Adam heads north to the dangerous oil fields of Alberta, while Jamie keeps the Coquihalla Highway open all by himself.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team inspects a collection of fossils from Mazon Creek in Illinois, before taking a gamble on a blackjack table.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team has the chance to buy a piece of US sporting history, a 1970 Bob Dylan vinyl record is brought into the shop, and Chumlee is on a mission in Las Vegas.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it, continuing in Bristol, Belfast, Whitby and Edinburgh.

programme.title: Don't Say It, Bring It
programme.desc: Game show presented by Jason Byrne, in which he challenges people to bring back the answer to a question, but not to say it, visiting Newcastle-upon-Tyne, Bristol and Whitby.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: When they uncover one of the rarest motorcycles in the world, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz must muster more cash than ever to seal the deal.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Lori is angry when Brandon cuts a deal with rival Jesse.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori are unsure of how to react when Jesse's bidding becomes aggressive.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While combing through an impressive collection, Mike finds a rare Ford, and the guys pick a Tennessee home hiding a big secret.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The picking gets red, hot and blue in a Louisiana warehouse as Mike makes a move on Gypsy Grandma, the queen of arcade games.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The competing teams' motorless vehicles use gravity as their only form of propulsion in the Belgian capital of Brussels.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: James May visits California to learn about the hydrogen-fuelled Honda FCX Clarity, and Jeremy Clarkson assesses the performance of Tesla's battery-powered supercar the Roadster. Richard Hammond looks back over 50 years of British touring car racing, and singer Tom Jones is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Border Force: America's Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Customs and Border Protection officers are stunned when they discover more than $2million of cocaine mixed in with gallons of household paint and bottles of beer.

programme.title: Scrapyard Supercar
programme.desc: Pro driver Shane Lynch takes on engineer Ralph Hosier and his teams of mechanics, who are aiming to prove a supercar can be beaten by homemade scrap. This time, they get down and dirty in an off-road scramble versus the Bentley Bentayga - can a car synonymous with class and style be beaten by cars made from cast-offs?.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May head to New Zealand to take part in a race along the coastline to the tip of the North Island - with one behind the wheel of a car and the other in an America's Cup yacht. Back in the UK, Richard Hammond tries out three hot hatches as he puts the Renaultsport Clio 200, Peugeot 208 GTi and Ford Fiesta ST through their paces, and a host of stars including Warwick Davis, Charles Dance and Joss Stone assemble at the test track to welcome a new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson gets behind the wheel of the Ferrari F12 Berlinetta, sampling the punch of its 730bhp V12 engine on the open roads of Scotland. Richard Hammond harnesses the power of motorsport on a quest to find the world's best taxi, and James May pays tribute to the former BBC Television Centre in White City, London, using a motorcyclist and a pair of parkour runners. Plus, the BAC Mono - an astonishingly fast car with just one seat - is put through its paces on the test track, and film director Ron Howard goes for a spin in the new Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Taskmaster: Champion of Champions
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Katherine Ryan, Noel Fielding, Rob Beckett and Bob Mortimer return for more consensual indignity at the hands of Greg Davies and Alex Horne.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Comedians Ellie Taylor and Josh Widdicombe, actor and writer Steve Pemberton and presenter Fern Britton take part in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by Radio 1 DJ Clara Amfo, actor Tom Davis, actor and musician Shaun Ryder and comedian Henning Wehn, aiming to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ellie Taylor, Fin Taylor, Tez Ilyas
programme.desc: Ellie Taylor from BBC Two's The Mash Report presents stand-up comedy from London's Hammersmith Apollo, inviting rising star Fin Taylor and the provocative Tez Ilyas to the stage.

programme.title: Big Zuu's Big Eats
programme.desc: Grime artist and self-taught chef Big Zuu takes his food truck to Croydon to meet with Jimmy Carr and cook his ultimate meal ready for when he steps off stage.

programme.title: Comedy Against Living Miserably
programme.desc: Stand-up comedy special, hosted and headlined by Joel Dommett, with support from Kiri Pritchard-Mclean, John Robins and Judi Love.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A rapper has to defend himself against claims he's getting too close to his fans. And a wife is furious at her husband for his extreme ironing antics.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson embarks on an expedition along Dorset's Jurassic coast to explore the county's hidden Second World War story. Starting beside the defences on Chesil Beach, he heads east to finish in Swanage and Studland Bay. On his five-day walk he encounters stunning scenery and uncovers wartime acts of ingenuity and bravery. He also discovers the crucial part a swannery played in developing a secret weapon and reveals the role of Dorset in protecting Britain from invasion during the conflict.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson sets off on a 45-mile hike through the countryside of the Weald in Kent and the Downs of East Sussex to discover the area's rich and surprising Tudor heritage. At Penshurst Place, author Philippa Gregory helps him relish the fate of the Grand Duke of Buckingham at the hands of the young Henry VIII. From there, he travels up what used to be secret paths to Hever Castle and finds out how the monarch's reign brought not only huge social, political and industrial change, but also fame and disaster to the women who caught his eye He ends this leg of his journey in Lewes, where he relives one of the more brutal monastic dissolutions.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson goes on a four-day trek through the Kintail region of the north-western Highlands, examining the story of the Jacobite uprisings of the early 1700s along the way. He starts by visiting Iron Age dwellings in Shiel Bridge, and heads to the rebuilt castle on Eilean Donan, the original of which was destroyed after invading Spanish troops landed there and were attacked by British warships. Tony ends in Glen Shiel, the site of a climactic battle in 1719 where royalist troops defeated the rebels.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: In Search of the Real King Arthur
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates the truth behind the legend of King Arthur, and looks for evidence of whether the mythical monarch was English, Scottish or Welsh.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of the Allied forces hunt for Joachim Peiper, the man responsible for the massacre of American PoWs in Malmedy, Belgium.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The award-winning documentary series reveals how the end of the Second World War resulted in Britain's military and economic exhaustion, leaving Europe at the mercy of sparring superpowers as the Cold War era dawned. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The story of how a town established by Henry Ford in the 1920s has been left to rot in the Amazonian rainforest. Plus, Mysterious monoliths scattered over a Polish forest.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.sub-title: The Tablelands Railways Line - Jungle Secrets
programme.desc: The Tablelands Railway Line in Queensland, Australia, which changed the face of one of the country's great states when it was constructed in the late 1800s.

programme.title: Mountain: Life at the Extreme
programme.desc: The extraordinary animals and people who make their homes in mountain ranges around the world, beginning with the Rockies. The mountains are the spine of North America, a beautiful wilderness of snowcapped peaks and hidden valleys, home to many animals including cougars, wolves and grizzly bears.

programme.title: Spy in the Wild
programme.desc: The undercover cameras reveal how animals often get up to mischief among themselves - and some are downright criminal. A colony of adelie penguins hunker down to avoid a storm, unaware one of them is a thief out to steal the stones that make up their nests, and Spy Tropicbird witnesses an aerial attack by aggressive frigate birds who attempt to steal his fish. A boisterous elephant has a temper tantrum in the mud near the waterhole, chimpanzees have extra-marital affairs and lemurs get high by sniffing toxic millipedes.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The pursuit of former Austrian policeman Franz Stangl, who served as commandant of the Nazi extermination camps Sobibor and Treblinka.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Jeremy Isaacs' classic documentary explores the Second World War's powerful legacy. For many people the conflict was the most significant experience of their lives, but it also left millions dead - ordinary civilians and victims of persecution, as well as military casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: An advanced German battleship that sank in a Norwegian fjord during the Second World War, the Miles Glacier Bridge in Alaska, and a mysterious concrete giant in Bulgaria.

programme.title: Secrets of the Solar System
programme.desc: A grand tour of the solar system, unravelling secrets that the planets have harboured for millions of years, and discovering that Earth almost never existed at all.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: In this feature-length episode of the drama, Sam's professional skills are tested to the limit following the murder of a close friend, and the evidence leads her into a deadly game with a deranged psychopath. Drama, starring Amanda Burton and Nick Reding.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PCs Hemmingway and Bryant arrange a battle of the sexes against Roger Valentine and Dan Casper which boosts Sun Hill's clear-up rate at one stroke, but Gina's decision to celebrate their success in the pub while still on duty gives Amanda Prosser all the leverage she needs to get rid of the boozy Inspector. Ramani and Terry accept they will never be friends and Pippa Manson creates an embarrassing scene at the station when she learns Neil's investigations led to her father's death.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The entire station is at a loss after Hallam's death, none more so than his widow Sandra, who has to be accompanied home by a Brigade Counsellor.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank is having trouble at work but Ricky is about to send him over the edge and Arthur cooks Pauline a meal to get her to forgive him.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Major Radley decides to stage an escape and evasion exercise. Meanwhile, Bernie Roberts is faced with a crisis. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Marsha loses some of the nursery fund's money, and attracts suspicion when the other mothers notice her son has an expensive new bike.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: PCs Hemmingway and Bryant arrange a battle of the sexes against Roger Valentine and Dan Casper which boosts Sun Hill's clear-up rate at one stroke, but Gina's decision to celebrate their success in the pub while still on duty gives Amanda Prosser all the leverage she needs to get rid of the boozy Inspector. Ramani and Terry accept they will never be friends and Pippa Manson creates an embarrassing scene at the station when she learns Neil's investigations led to her father's death.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Matt and Donna row over Bridie's death, with both keen to blame the other, but the arrival of the nurse's grandmother visiting her boyfriend in the hospital gives the doctor a chance to offer an olive branch. Connie offers Sam a position as trainee rep as the pair grow closer, much to Chrissie's annoyance, and a patient's dad asks Lola out on a date.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part one of two. A burns victim overhears Holly discussing Adam's HIV status and sells the story to a national newspaper, plunging Holby A&E into chaos as reporters besiege the department and leaving Charlie the responsibility of informing the blissfully ignorant nurse of the situation. Meanwhile, a girl's shopping spree almost ends in tragedy, Chloe encounters an unwelcome face from the past and Josh risks his life performing a rescue on a cliff face.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An operation to detain an aggressive and armed senile pensioner goes horribly wrong and Amanda Prosser makes Gina the scapegoat, forcing the Borough Commander to suspend her from duty while her drink problem is assessed. Detectives Nixon and Nadir get a lead on big-time gangster Pete Larson, but Dale Smith can't resist playing with fire by wooing the villain's lonely wife.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Frank's prank calls to the other cab firm have gone too far this time. Arthur sets up meeting to get Ron his stall back and poor Geta thinks Sanjay's up to no good.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: While preparations get under way at the Vic for a homecoming, Frank comes to a decision regarding the cab company, and Ian has some good news for Kathy.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The Blue Watch members realise life must go on following Hallam's death when Nick tells them a new sub-officer has been appointed.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Paul's god-daughter Amy arrives in Glenbogle intent on causing mischief, but he has precious little time for her as he deals with notorious poacher Tam's return to claim his mother's croft - and make trouble for the MacDonald family. Iona moves into the big house while her own is rebuilt, and Zoe's unimpressed by Ewan when he covers for Amy. Highland drama, with Lloyd Owen and Kellyanne Farquhar.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: Heartbroken that Karen has left Skelthwaite to take care of her heroin-addicted son in London, a dejected David yearns to leave the village, taking Jess with him - but soon discovers his daughter has made a happy life with new boyfriend Joe. Meanwhile, Sally catches truant schoolboy Nathan in a compromising situation with Candida, and Anna fears for the health of elderly farm owner Essie Crayford. Rural drama, starring Philip Middlemiss, Kelly Wenham and Danny Seward.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: Sharon gets a passion for democracy - and decides to buy Darryl's vote from Tracey for the local by-election. Robert Llewellyn guests stars, with Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: The Green Green Grass
programme.sub-title: If You Go Down to the Woods
programme.desc: Marlene is distraught when Tyler and Earl the dog go missing. Boycie, Bryan and Jed form a search party, but hunting through the haunted woods at night proves a less than pleasant experience for the would-be rescuers. John Challis and Sue Holderness star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy persuades Clegg and Compo that starting a dog-walking business will be no work at all since they are already going on daily countryside rambles. However, the experience proves to be more of a workout than the trio envisage. Brian Wilde, Peter Sallis and Bill Owen star.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Foggy, Clegg and Compo hit on a solution to their transport problems - building their own bikes. Meanwhile, Sid and Ivy's cafe has been redecorated and is set for its grand re-opening. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde.

programme.title: Shakespeare & Hathaway - Private Investigators
programme.desc: Frank Hathaway finds an unlikely partner in Lu Shakespeare when the pair are thrown together to catch a killer and clear her name. Comedy drama about an oddball pair of private detectives who investigate crime in Stratford-upon-Avon, starring Mark Benton and Jo Joyner.

programme.title: The Coroner
programme.desc: Jane and Davey investigate a skydiving accident and discover that someone had tampered with the victim's parachute. Crime drama, starring Claire Goose.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Part one of two. Brian is suspended after assaulting a high-ranking officer in the Met, suspecting him of covering up a death in custody years before. Meanwhile, an Argentinian pistol recovered from the Thames is linked to two unsolved murders which took place 16 years apart - and with one of them having occurred in Gibraltar, Sandra takes the team - minus Brian - on an Iberian adventure to uncover the truth. Alun Armstrong, Amanda Redman, Dennis Waterman and Denis Lawson star in the crime drama.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam is called in to investigate when the lifeless body of Gemma, a 17-year-old estate agent, is found in an empty house. Delving into the girl's family history, the forensic pathologist discovers she was thrown out of her home by her mother for having a child at the age of 13. Claims that Gemma was having an affair with her mother's second husband further complicates Sam's inquiries. Drama, starring Amanda Burton.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.sub-title: Take a Walk on the Merseyside
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five family members answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the big-prize quiz in which another line-up of contestants answer the questions that could change their lives - with the lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.sub-title: Saving Money: Tips for Lockdown - Tonight
programme.desc: With pay cuts, job losses and businesses shut down for weeks, the financial impact of coronavirus is hitting people hard. Helen Skelton investigates the best ways for people to tighten their belts and try to save money.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five members of the East Yorkshire rounders team the Beverley Bombers answer questions about top 10 lists, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Game show, hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Malone and Harriet have another encounter, while Al is delighted when Priya reveals she is ready to go public with their relationship, but their plans are cut short when Jai walks in on them. Cain and Moira meet to finalise their divorce, and Leanna relishes wrecking her dad's relationship.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Oliver suffers another frightening seizure and is moved to intensive care, much to Steve and Leanne's horror. Ed and Michael experience racism at work, while Gemma attends a support group for her depression and takes comfort from realising other people are in the same position as her.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: As the comedy returns, there's bad news for the Stubbs family as they hear that Tracey's ex-husband has died and she has to decide what kind of send-off to give him. Sharon wants it to be nice for the boys, Chigwell's criminal fraternity are keen to make it special, while Dorien seems more interested in just finding the right outfit. Linda Robson, Pauline Quirke and Lesley Joseph star, with appearances from Spandau Ballet's Martin Kemp and one-time EastEnder Jamie Foreman (Derek Branning).

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The family are devastated when unscrupulous burglars take advantage of their absence at Darryl's funeral to ransack the house. But rather than involve the Old Bill, they decide to track down their possessions themselves, setting out on a trail that takes them from a snooker parlour and a pawnbroker's to an infamous local drag club. Comedy, starring Pauline Quirke and Linda Robson.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson hosts the big-prize quiz in which another line-up of contestants answer the questions that could change their lives - with the lifelines Ask the Audience, Phone a Friend, 50-50 and Ask the Host available to them if they get stuck.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: Marc Warren steps into the shoes of Barry Foster to take on the role of Dutch detective Van der Valk in this updated adaptation of the Amsterdam-based crime drama.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The way billions of bees help produce tons of California almonds, how snow is cleared to keep planes functional in Norway, and the removal of tricky stains.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer has a budget of £5,000 to buy a Lotus Esprit and finds one without an MOT. Edd China's work begins with removing the interior and the engine.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: The twins ride the Redball Express, while Bruce Crompton blows up a van with Second World War rifle grenades and tracks down a 'Deuce-and-a-half' American army truck.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Jason is offended by Paul Sr's criticism of his designs, while PJD begins work on a bike to celebrate a company's centenary.

programme.title: Alaska Mega Machines
programme.desc: A rugged ship built to withstand tsunami-size waves travels on a highway unlike any other in North America. Plus, a fleet of machines combats a massive flood.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.sub-title: Dirty Jobs of the Big Apple
programme.desc: Mike Rowe heads to New York, where he experiences life working alongside an elevator repairman.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind the creation of Montreal smoked meats and motorised scooters are detailed.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: Another selection of everyday items are deconstructed, including cactus pear puree and lab reactors.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The complex processes involved in creating modern-day paving stones. Plus, the construction of a traditionally tailored tuxedo suit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters - Best Buys
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard counts down some of the most memorable items he has picked up in amazing locales.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: A deckhand and the captain of the Cornelia Marie clash over the vessel's crippling lack of bait, and the Time Bandit's newest crew member goes to pirate school.

programme.title: Dive Wars Australia
programme.desc: The divers demonstrate the difficulties of preserving wild abalone stocks, which have gone extinct in some parts of the world due to over-fishing.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: In Southampton, a new cable-eating machine is ready to turn scrap into gold. Plus, the metal from a disused aeroplane is being turned into a profit in Hampshire.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys a G Wagen, a popular German 4x4. Mechanic Edd China spruces it up with a 2012 front end and rear lights, but it may not be enough for them to turn a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: A Bentley Le Mans Replica is being flown in from England, with Wayne Carini excited to test drive it.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini is ecstatic when an exceptional collection of motorcycles and a classic Ferrari, worth between five and eight million dollars, comes up for sale.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: An insight into large-scale iron-mining operations in the Australian Outback. Plus, how the world's biggest wave machine is used for flood defences.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at the development of the finest oyster knives, and the lights transforming sport worldwide. Plus, how diamonds grown in a greenhouse are behind a gemstone revolution.

programme.title: Disasters at Sea
programme.sub-title: The Sinking of the Lady Mary
programme.desc: In March 2009, scallop fishing boat the Lady Mary sank off the coast of New Jersey, killing six crew and leaving only one survivor. This edition explains how the tragedy occured.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: An inexperienced crewman leaves the Seabrooke in shame, and treacherous waters surrounding St Paul island make offloading crab extremely hazardous.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce travels from Plymouth to Illinois by buying and selling various German hardware, while his mate Kevin purchases the last remaining German torpedo boat for five million pounds.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In a quiet south London suburb, Drew Pritchard comes face to face with the most extraordinary collection of American automobilia he's ever seen, including Evel Knievel's Messerschmitt.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The work of demolition, salvage and waste management experts as they blast, crush and smash their way through a variety of structures which have had their day. In the world of destruction, they take huge risks, every time they blow up, demolish and dismantle. From tower blocks to ships and bridges to Victorian mansions…every inch of material is removed as everything has value if you know where to take it and, more importantly, when to sell it.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers: On the Road
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer has a budget of £5,000 to buy a Lotus Esprit and finds one without an MOT. Edd China's work begins with removing the interior and the engine.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The mining season is almost over and Col's crew takes one last gamble opal-spotting from the air. The Cooke brothers strive to save their mega opal machine and disastrous season.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits a north London emporium full of antique shop fittings that will surprise. Then, Drew and Tee visit a Second World War hospital museum in Suffolk.

programme.title: Aliens: The Definitive Guide
programme.desc: Part one of two. Scientists investigate the possibility of extra-terrestrial life, beginning with what aliens might look like and how they could sound.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Vast gold resources lie among south east Asia's island rivers, but they are also home to crocodiles, and locals need the help of professional to extract the valuable ore.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology series reveals how New York is able to run on steam, and details the processes perfected by Belgian monks responsible for making some of the world's finest beers.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How volcanos contribute to the production of guacamole and the development of trucks capable of crossing swamps. Plus, the method used to produce the world-famous Fiskars scissors brand.

programme.title: Dead of Winter
programme.desc: After Kay Weden found her 77-year-old mother Catherine Miller shot dead in her home, investigators discovered the frozen remains of her boyfriend in the Blue Ridge Mountains. When investigators spoke with Kay, they realised that she was being stalked.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How investigators are devoting time to cracking cartels in a sinister criminal underground spawned by the prevalence of drug trafficking.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of devoted wife and hardworking paralegal Cynthia Langrall. When the 57-year-old was shot dead on her morning run, police were baffled as to who would commit the crime. Neighbours told police that they heard two gunshots and a few had spotted a car in the area that was caught on some CCTV footage.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The 2011 murder of Melissa White, whose body was found in her backyard. When investigators took a closer look at the neighbours, they unearthed a secret and had to work out whether it could be connected with the killing.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: An 11-year-old girl's body is found washed up on a beach, prompting federal investigators to look into her uncle's background.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: SPCA staff and volunteers are called in to remove almost 200 birds and mammals from an animal sanctuary after allegations of neglect. An investigator is just in time to save four chihuahuas from starvation, while nine dogs and four cats are rescued from a filthy house.

programme.title: Bondi Vet: Coast to Coast
programme.desc: A cat is brought into the clinic soon after giving birth, could there be another kitten on the way? Plus, Alison and Audrey check out some lumps on a golden retriever.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Having beaten cancer, Kristin is ready to marry her high-school sweetheart, while Latoya wants a ball gown with plenty of bling.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli counts down his favourite dresses for big-spending brides shopping at the top end of the market.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Randy Knows Best
programme.sub-title: Top 10 Things to Know Before Buying a Dress
programme.desc: Randy Fenoli reveals the things every bride should know before shopping for a wedding dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris is reunited with an old friend, Pluto the singing dalmatian. Plus, cocker spaniel Dusty needs radical ear surgery.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Trischa Price investigates a report of a sick horse, but is confused when she finds discarded hypodermic needles nearby.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Investigators rescue a 25-year-old chimpanzee living alone in a cage at his owner's house.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The cases of a woman's death and the abduction of a young boy help to illustrate how co-operation from the public can help forensic investigators.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: A case in which an attractive, young woman moved to the US for a new opportunity, only to vanish without a trace a few weeks later. Previous kidnapping survivor Elizabeth Smart joined in the search.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 21-year-old party animal Kortne Stouffer, who vanished from her Pennsylvania apartment in July 2012 after rowing with neighbours and friends.

programme.title: The Perfect Murder
programme.desc: The case of 42-year-old Miami mother Raquel Calderin, who vanished on her way home from work. The investigation led detectives into a disturbing family picture.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Carli arrives at the salon with an entourage in tow, while Jessica brings her baby, mother, aunt and two friends to attend her wedding dress fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Ivania returns to Kleinfeld Bridal for a reselection, hoping her fiance will agree to the dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Margarita already has two gowns but is determined to buy a third, while wedding-obsessed Amanda begins searching for her dream dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nicole and her vocal family visit the store, while Amanda's mother refuses to leave until her daughter's dress is fixed.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Nancy's father and uncle join in and help consultant Diane search for an ideal dress, while bride Nicole relies on her dad for a second opinion.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Cherine's fantasy is to resemble an Egyptian Barbie on her wedding day, while Jessica seeks a dress that will look good with fairy wings.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three British collectors with a love of all things vintage are given 800 euros to spend in the unspoilt village of Sommieres near Montpellier. They're looking for items that need a little bit of love and attention before selling on their items in Harrogate, North Yorkshire, hoping to make a profit. JP proves just too nice to haggle with, Julie gives numerous nods to shabby chic and Shafia pushes relentlessly on price to prove everyone wrong.

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In London Road pawnbrokers in Sheffield, boss Dan Hatfield and his sister Cherise try to negotiate a deal on a tuk-tuk, and cobbler Peter is looking for a quick cash deal on some designer shoes and an antique clock. Meanwhile, at Pickwick pawnbrokers in London, Nathan Finch secures deals on a classic silver Clipper caravan, some war memorabilia and several designer luxury bags.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 700lbs, Teretha's life is confined to a bed. Her family fears losing her and hopes a gastric bypass will provide the solution she needs to save her life.

programme.title: 10 Steps to Murder
programme.desc: The shocking discovery of 80-year-old Lea Adri-Soejoko's body in an allotment shed unraveled a tragic story. Detectives and her family recount the steps that led to her murder.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: As a young boy, Michael Blanco had seen his mother do violent things that seemed straight out of the movies. However, he never once doubted that she did those things to keep their family safe - until the day he learned the truth.

programme.title: Bloodline Detectives
programme.desc: In 2018, two paralegals were shot dead while at work in Scottsdale, Arizona. Four more victims were linked to the killing - and a serial killer was supected of being at large.
